name: Uruguay
description: Uruguay, officially the Oriental Republic of Uruguay, is a country in South America, known for its vast grasslands (pampas), rolling hills, and relatively small population. It boasts a stable democracy, a strong agricultural sector, and a vibrant cultural scene. The country’s coastline stretches along the Atlantic Ocean, offering diverse landscapes and opportunities for both relaxation and adventure.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, a major economic and cultural hub.
quickFacts.detail: Montevideo is situated on the Río de la Plata and is characterized by its European-influenced architecture and lively atmosphere.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Uruguay has a relatively small and welcoming population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is low, contributing to a relaxed pace of life and a strong sense of community.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A compact nation with diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: Uruguay is one of the smallest countries in South America, but its size is sufficient to support a wide range of ecosystems.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Uruguayan Spanish has distinct regional variations.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The local currency used for transactions.
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally offers good value for travelers.

quickFacts.label: Government
quickFacts.detail: Uruguay is recognized for its progressive social policies and commitment to human rights.

climateData.title: Climate of Uruguay
climateData.description: Uruguay experiences a humid subtropical climate, characterized by warm, humid summers and mild, relatively dry winters. Rainfall is generally evenly distributed throughout the year, though there are seasonal variations.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The warmest and most humid season, with high temperatures and frequent rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A transition period with cooler temperatures and decreasing rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest season, with mild temperatures and occasional snowfall in the southern regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A pleasant season with warming temperatures and increasing rainfall.

naturalWonders.name: Colonia del Sacramento Historic Site
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Colonia del Sacramento is a charming colonial town on the Río de la Plata. Its cobblestone streets, historic buildings, and picturesque harbor offer a glimpse into Uruguay's rich past.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Founded by the Portuguese in the 18th century, Colonia del Sacramento was later occupied by the Spanish. Today, it’s a living museum, showcasing a blend of European architectural styles and a relaxed, bohemian atmosphere.
viewingTips: Take a boat tour of the Río de la Plata

naturalWonders.name: Tierra del Fuego National Park
naturalWonders.description: Located at the southern tip of Uruguay, this park protects a unique ecosystem of Magellanic beech forests, wetlands, and grasslands.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Tierra del Fuego National Park is a haven for wildlife, including numerous bird species, deer, and guanacos. The park’s diverse landscapes offer opportunities for hiking, birdwatching, and experiencing the raw beauty of Patagonia.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Uruguay
ecosystemData.overview: Uruguay’s diverse landscapes support a range of ecosystems, including grasslands, wetlands, forests, and coastal areas. The country’s commitment to conservation has helped preserve these valuable habitats.

biodiversityCategories.name: Grasslands (Pampas)
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominating the landscape, the pampas are vast, open grasslands that support a unique array of plant and animal life.

statistics.details: Approximately 80% of Uruguay's land area is covered by pampas.
Over 200 species of birds and mammals call the pampas home.

notableSpecies.name: Guanaco
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of the pampas, the guanaco is a wild relative of the llama.

notableSpecies.name: Southern Lapwing
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory bird that breeds in the pampas during the summer.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Uruguay’s wetlands are vital habitats for migratory birds and other wildlife, playing a crucial role in flood control and water purification.

statistics.details: Approximately 1.5 million hectares of wetlands are found throughout Uruguay.
Over 150 species of migratory and resident birds rely on wetlands for survival.

notableSpecies.name: Roseate Spoonbill
notableSpecies.significance: A striking pink bird that feeds in the wetlands' shallow waters.

notableSpecies.name: Flamingo
notableSpecies.significance: Large flocks of flamingos can be seen feeding in the wetlands during the winter.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Uruguay
activities.description: Uruguay offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Uruguay’s scenic trails and discover hidden landscapes.

activities.name: Coastal Trail Hike
activities.description: Hike along the Atlantic coast, enjoying stunning ocean views and diverse coastal flora and fauna.

activities.name: Pampas Trail Trek
activities.description: Experience the vastness of the pampas on a gentle trail trek, observing wildlife and enjoying the tranquility of the grasslands.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Atlantic Ocean and Uruguay’s numerous lagoons and rivers.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch some waves at Uruguay’s popular surf spots.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the tranquil lagoons and rivers of Uruguay by kayak.

clothing.winter: Warm jacket, sweater, waterproof pants, scarf, gloves

equipment.basic: Reusable water bottle, backpack, insect repellent
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, first-aid kit
